intro: Phyllonoma tenuidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyllonoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive, lobed structure, and its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
